The height of the root node is 3, and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node is 17.

The root node is u, and it has 3 edges leading to v, w, and qb. v has 4 edges leading to w, ab, bb, and gc. w has 6 edges leading to x, y, z, ab, bc, and gc. bb has 3 edges leading to cb, db, and eb. v has 2 edges leading to gb, lb. gc has 2 edges leading to hc and ic. lb has 2 edges leading to mb, nb. u has 2 edges leading to v and qb.

The height of a node is the length of the longest path from that node to any leaf node. In this case, the height of u is 3 because it has 3 edges leading to v, which has 4 edges leading to w, which has 6 edges leading to a leaf node (ac). Therefore, the longest path from u to any leaf node is a sequence of 3 nodes (u -> v -> w -> ac), which has a length of 7 edges.

So the height of the root node is 3, and the number of edges in the longest path from the root node to any leaf node is 17.
